metadata.value: A consuming customer should have a security awareness program to help to educate their users on how to reuce the likelihood of being socially engineered. See article [Amazon releases free cybersecurity awareness training](https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/community/amazon-releases-free-cybersecurity-awareness-training)

assumptions.content: Security awareness training is the most effective mitigation against social engineering attacks, and one cannot rely solely on technical mitigations
Customer deploying solution will follow AWS Well-Architected best practices
We cannot protect against threats on the client endpoint
For general users, modern browsers have adequate protection for access to local browser storage
TLS 1.2 is an adequate mitigation for threats related to tampering and information disclosure of data in transit over the network.

metadata.value: Implementation in code - [PDK Static Website construct - S3 access logging](https://github.com/aws/aws-prototyping-sdk/blob/mainline/packages/static-website/src/static-website.ts#L161)

Implementation in code -  [Custom security headers within CloudFront](https://github.com/awslabs/threat-composer/blob/6023777f95ede74d63bf95d0a0fac8f7787d8b35/packages/threat-composer-infra/src/application-stack.ts#L66)

mitigations.content: Custom security headers (including HTTP Strict Transport Security)
Restrictive default for WebACL associated with CloudFront distribution

metadata.value:
By using popular, well-known and industry recognised NPM packages it is believed that this increases the likelihood that any integrity concerns with the package would be discovered more quickly, and that there would be industry and community urgency in disclosing and remediating.

See [package.json](https://github.com/awslabs/threat-composer/blob/main/package.json) for NPN packages used by this project.

mitigations.content: Using well-known and industry recognised NPM packages
GitHub Dependabot security updates are configured on the maintainers GitHub repository

metadata.value: GitHub branch protection rules of `main` to ensure that a manual code review by maintainers is required before merge

mitigations.content: Access control to GitHub organization and repository

metadata.value:
- Implementation in code - [PDK Static Website construct - CloudFront distribution configuration](https://github.com/aws/aws-prototyping-sdk/blob/mainline/packages/static-website/src/static-website.ts#L215)

- Implementation in code - [PDK Static Website construct - S3 Bucket configuration](https://github.com/aws/aws-prototyping-sdk/blob/mainline/packages/static-website/src/static-website.ts#L152)

mitigations.content: UI import warning 'Only import from trusted sources'
Disable HTML support on Markdown viewer

metadata.value: AWS Shield Standard provides protection for all AWS customers against common and most frequently occurring Infrastructure (layer 3 and 4) attacks like SYN/UDP Floods, Reflection attacks, and others to support high availability of your applications on AWS. [more](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/ddos-standard-summary.html)
Implementation in code - [PDK Static Website construct - OAI configuration](https://github.com/aws/aws-prototyping-sdk/blob/mainline/packages/static-website/src/static-website.ts#LL213C13-L213C33)
Implementation in code - [PDK Static Website construct - S3 Block public access](https://github.com/aws/aws-prototyping-sdk/blob/mainline/packages/static-website/src/static-website.ts#L159)

threats.statement: A lorem ipsum lorem ipsum can lorem ipsum, which leads to lorem ipsum, negatively impacting lorem ipsum
threats.threatAction: lorem ipsum

metadata.value: lorem ipsum. lorem ipsum lorem ipsum

threats.prerequisites: that is able to trick a user into installing a malicous userscript extension (e.g. tampermonkey, browser extension)
threats.threatAction: read the contents of local browser storage
threats.threatImpact: the exfiltration of the contents of browser storage to an endpoint controlled by the actor
threats.statement: A threat actor that is able to trick a user into installing a malicous userscript extension (e.g. tampermonkey, browser extension) can read the contents of local browser storage, which leads to the exfiltration of the contents of browser storage to an endpoint controlled by the actor, resulting in reduced confidentiality of application metadata, threats, mitigations and assumptions

threats.prerequisites: that is able to target a user already using a benign userscript extension (e.g. tampermonkey) that integrates directly with local browser storage for quickly viewing a Threat Composer export
threats.threatAction: trick them into opening a malicious threat model that contains script tags (or similar)
threats.threatImpact: the exfiltration of the contents of browser storage via XSS due to the extension bypassing Threat Composers import validation and sanitisation protection
threats.statement: A threat actor that is able to target a user already using a benign userscript extension (e.g. tampermonkey) that integrates directly with local browser storage for quickly viewing a Threat Composer export can trick them into opening a malicious threat model that contains script tags (or similar), which leads to the exfiltration of the contents of browser storage via XSS due to the extension bypassing Threat Composers import validation and sanitisation protection, resulting in reduced confidentiality of application metadata, threats, mitigations and assumptions

threats.prerequisites: with knowledge of a browser image render vulnerability
threats.threatAction: trick a user into importing a malicious JSON file containing malicious BASE64 images
threats.threatImpact: exfiltration the contents of local storage to and end-point controlled by the actor
threats.statement: A threat actor with knowledge of a browser image render vulnerability can trick a user into importing a malicious JSON file containing malicious BASE64 images, which leads to exfiltration the contents of local storage to and end-point controlled by the actor, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: that can trick a user into importing a JSON file
threats.threatAction: input a unexpected data schema
threats.threatImpact: the user being unable to use the tool, until they clear the local data (or use a different browser)
threats.statement: A threat actor that can trick a user into importing a JSON file can input an unexpected data schema, which leads to the user being unable to use the tool, until they clear the local data (or use a different browser)

threats.prerequisites: with access the browser DOM (e.g. via Dev Tools)
threats.threatAction: disable client-side input validation regex
threats.threatImpact: allowing them to demonstrate a Cross-site Script (XSS) vulnerability
threats.statement: A threat actor with access the browser DOM (e.g. via Dev Tools) can disable client-side input validation regex, which leads to allowing them to demonstrate a Cross-site Script (XSS) vulnerability, resulting in reduced integrity of threat composer

threats.prerequisites: with access the browser DOM (e.g. via Dev Tools)
threats.threatAction: can input a datatype not expected by the code
threats.statement: A threat actor with access the browser DOM (e.g. via Dev Tools) can can input a datatype not expected by the code, resulting in reduced availability of threat composer

threats.prerequisites: who has forked and modified the source code to include their own data (e.g. additional example threat statements)
threats.threatAction: deploy Threat composer without network restrictions or authentication
threats.threatImpact: discovery of the additional data by an adversary
threats.statement: A valid user who has forked and modified the source code to include their own data (e.g. additional example threat statements) can deploy Threat composer without network restrictions or authentication, which leads to discovery of the additional data by an adversary, resulting in reduced confidentiality

threats.threatAction: take advantage of security vulnerability within a 3rd party package used by Threat Composer
threats.statement: A threat actor can take advantage of security vulnerability within a 3rd party package used by Threat Composer, resulting in reduced integrity of threat composer

threats.threatAction: raise a PR (Pull Request) on the source within the Threat Composer GitHub repo
threats.threatImpact: merging malicious code that exfiltrates user-supplied input to an end-point that they control
threats.statement: A threat actor can raise a PR (Pull Request) on the source within the Threat Composer GitHub repo, which leads to merging malicious code that exfiltrates user-supplied input to an end-point that they control, negatively impacting threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.threatAction: provide malicious input (e.g. script tags) into the Threat Composer UI
threats.threatImpact: to them finding and demonstrating an XSS vulnerability which they make public via social media
threats.statement: A security researcher can provide malicious input (e.g. script tags) into the Threat Composer UI, which leads to to them finding and demonstrating an XSS vulnerability which they make public via social media, negatively impacting threat composer

threats.prerequisites: that can trick a user into importing a malicious JSON file containing script tags (or similar)
threats.threatAction: exfiltrate the contents of local storage using XSS
threats.statement: A threat actor that can trick a user into importing a malicious JSON file containing script tags (or similar) can exfiltrate the contents of local storage using XSS, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: who has access to a dependent software package on a npm remote registry (e.g. yarnpkg.com, npmjs.com)
threats.threatAction: inject malicious code into the CI/CD process
threats.threatImpact: untrusted code running in a users browser
threats.statement: A threat actor who has access to a dependent software package on a npm remote registry (e.g. yarnpkg.com, npmjs.com) can inject malicious code into the CI/CD process, which leads to untrusted code running in a users browser, resulting in reduced integrity of threat composer

threats.prerequisites: with a network path to the CloudFront distribution
threats.threatAction: submit a large number of resource intensive requests
threats.statement: A threat actor with a network path to the CloudFront distribution can submit a large number of resource intensive requests, which leads to unnecessary and/or excessive costs, resulting in reduced economy of threat composer

threats.threatAction: create or orchestrate a distributed denial of service attack against the CloudFront Distribution serving the static content
threats.threatImpact: to the web tool being unresponsive to callers
threats.statement: A threat actor can create or orchestrate a distributed denial of service attack against the CloudFront Distribution serving the static content, which leads to to the web tool being unresponsive to callers, resulting in reduced availability of threat composer

threats.prerequisites: with possession of a similar domain name
threats.threatAction: trick our users into interacting with an illegitimate endpoint
threats.statement: A threat actor with possession of a similar domain name can trick our users into interacting with an illegitimate endpoint, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: who has a sufficiently privileged IAM Principal in the AWS account
threats.threatAction: modify the configuration of the CloudFront distribution
threats.threatImpact: the distribution serving content from an origin that is unexpected or contains malicious content
impactedAssets: code running in the user's browser
threats.statement: An external threat actor who has a sufficiently privileged IAM Principal in the AWS account can modify the configuration of the CloudFront distribution, which leads to the distribution serving content from an origin that is unexpected or contains malicious content, resulting in reduced integrity of code running in the user's browser and application configuration

threats.prerequisites: with write access to the objects hosted on the static asset S3 Bucket
threats.threatAction: modify the code
threats.threatImpact: exfiltration of user-supplied input to an attacker controlled endpoint
threats.statement: A threat actor with write access to the objects hosted on the static asset S3 Bucket can modify the code, which leads to exfiltration of user-supplied input to an attacker controlled endpoint, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-browser position
threats.threatAction: read or modify locally stored user input
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-browser position can read or modify locally stored user input, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: with local access to a web browser used by a valid user
threats.threatAction: read local storage
threats.statement: A threat actor with local access to a web browser used by a valid user can read local storage, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata

threats.prerequisites: who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the User and the hosting endpoint
threats.threatAction: tamper with, or replace the downloaded client-side code
threats.threatImpact: to exfiltrating user-specified input to an attacker controlled endpoint
threats.statement: A threat actor who is in a person-in-the-middle position between the User and the hosting endpoint can tamper with, or replace the downloaded client-side code, which leads to to exfiltrating user-specified input to an attacker controlled endpoint, resulting in reduced confidentiality of threats, mitigations, assumptions and application metadata
